node.title: Agriculture is booming, but are women and Indigenous people being left out?
node.alt: A woman wearing a hat and mask across her mouth stands in a dusty yard of goats.
node.description: National Agriculture Day is a day to celebrate farmers, but women and Indigenous people still face enormous challenges in the sector.
node.content:
["National Agriculture Day celebrates what the sector describes as its \"fabulous and fulfilling\"\u00a0career opportunities, from mustering cattle in the Top End to developing the next breakthrough wheat variety.", "While the sector is booming, with four to five jobs for every university graduate, does the industry need a cultural\u00a0overhaul?", "When the lens is placed on work practises, is a career in agriculture\u00a0truly that great for women leaders or young women trying to break into a male-dominated industry, or fabulous for Indigenous people who face obstacles to attain\u00a0qualifications\u00a0and later work?", "Student Jess Ryan from Crookwell in NSW thinks it is.", "\"I\u00a0love animals, love working with them, everything in the livestock industry is constantly changing and I love doing it every day,\" she said.", "Ms Ryan will soon graduate from a certificate IV in agricultural\u00a0studies\u00a0at TAFE NSW with a view to becoming a livestock agent.\u00a0", "", "
Jess Ryan shrugs off innate sexism.\u00a0(Supplied: TAFE NSW)
", "
Sexual harassment still a problem
", "While there are currently plenty\u00a0of opportunities, women still face significant challenges to work.", "Professor Skye Charry (formerly Saunders)\u00a0from the University of New England has been researching conditions in the sector.\u00a0", "In her most recent\u00a0report she found that 93 per cent of women in remote areas face sexual harassment at work.", "Her current research looks at male attitudes towards sexual harassment. She said it is\u00a0vital for men to understand the impacts of sexual abuse and harassment\u00a0in order for things to change.", "Ms Ryan, however, is not troubled by working in an industry dominated by men.", "\"It's a challenge.\u00a0I stick up for myself and I don't really let it get to me,\" she said.", "
Women at the top
", "Currently, more women than men study\u00a0agriculture\u00a0which is having a positive\u00a0flow-on effect to correct\u00a0gender imbalance in\u00a0management roles.", "", "
Tracey Martin of the Australian Agritech Association can see a bright future for women in the sector.(Supplied: Australian Agritech Association)
", "In a\u00a02016 census, half of all women working in agriculture identified as working in a manager's position, making up 28 per cent\u00a0of all people in that role.", "Tracey Martin has just been appointed as the first full-time CEO of the Australian Agritech Association.\u00a0", "Ms Martin said there were many agritech businesses that\u00a0are led and founded by women.", "\"Living in an agricultural community, on a station, it's really clear to me that women play a key role in change and building communities,\" she said.", "Ms Martin said there was always more that can be done to support women in the industry.", "
'Appalling'\u00a0figures on Indigenous students
", "Women are not the only ones facing significant challenges breaking into agriculture.", "Figures show\u00a0that an average of just five Indigenous students graduate\u00a0each year from agricultural courses at Australian universities.", "Professor of Agriculture at Charles Sturt University, Jim Prately, wants that to increase tenfold.\u00a0", "\"It's an appalling number, so we have to increase that number to some sort of respectability,\" he said.", "He said Indigenous representation in the sector, as well as in higher education, was too low.", "", "
Wiradjuri man Luke Murray is working at Riverina Oils and can see a lot of opportunity in agriculture.(ABC Rural: Olivia Calver)
", "Indigenous people make up\u00a0three\u00a0per cent of the population, but less than one per cent of the student population.", "\"Across Australia we ought to be putting out 20 to 50 graduates\u00a0a year.\"", "It is hard to recall a better time to get into agriculture.", "There are scholarships available to help Indigenous students attain\u00a0a qualification in agriculture, relocation allowances for people wanting to move out of the cities to work on the harvest, and a massive demand for workers due to the absence of backpackers and overseas workers.\u00a0", "Wiradjuri man Luke Murray is\u00a0employed as an inventory manager by Riverina Oils.", "He travelled from Queensland for the job and realised when he arrived just just how much the region produces.", "\"There are opportunities available here from growing the food, to transporting it to selling it,\" he said."]
